user.biography:
| You are art, 
And art is everything. |
All content is my own, unless stated otherwise.
#ofwheelsandwords

node.text:
When you've got friends like this, there's not a lot else you need. 

What a beautiful surprise. 

Made with ❤️ by Tallboi @abhisheknairofficial,
and alleged brainchild of @dr_popper_giri, 
I love you guys.
@cyanaidu you're the only one who didn't ask for credit but I know you're in the mix too hahah you know ily. 

@mockmyname I know you're swamped in the process of becoming one of the best surgeons I know you will turn to be, thank you for taking your time out to get your message to me. MKT5H forever. This wouldn't have been complete without your name on it. Ilee. 

@enthamarethi, Your art >>> 
absolutely made my day. I hear they chewed your ears off with ideas, so thank you for sticking with it and creating this for me on my birthday. 

To everyone else who sent messages/called with all your love, thank you so much. 
My heart is full.

node.text:
Spoken Poetry today.
I've been deliberating on this for a while now but could never find the courage or comfort to put it up. 
But here goes, let me know how you like it, 
Honest feedbacks much appreciated 🤍
.
.
🔸
There's a field I walk on barefoot, unafraid of the dirt that clings to my skin because this is soil where feelings come to die, unsoiled, unsullied. 

I'm a mortician for the unclaimed performing final rites as I scrub away the blood from wounds unhealed and wrap it neatly beneath white sheets. There's a purity in death that washes away the taint of life, so I lay to rest that which I hope will remain unperturbed;
You who never found peace in your existence, 
May you rest easy in extinction. 

I dig up pits in the ground to resemble the pits in my stomach from which I gave birth to those I now bury beneath my feet before they ever learned to walk;
You who never learnt to take your first breath out of the womb,
May you never need another as you lay in your tomb. 

I say a prayer as I build a graveyard without headstones, without labels, without names;
You who was never recognised in life,
May you learn that remembrance serves you no purpose in death. 

There are poems I write, 
unafraid of the ink that stains my skin because this is ink where feelings come to drown;
I recite them like a prayer, 
You ask me why I write, 
I tell you ,
"To bury dead parts of me so that I may live just right.
🔸 
. 
.
@silverleafpoetry @bleedingsoulpoetry @streetwritersofficial 
@unerasepoetry 
@poemsindia 
@evepoetrygroup

node.text:
Happy birthday to the biggest torture, and the no. 1 woman in my life ♥️
Please don't beat me again. (Subtitles already in for all my non Mallu friends dw I got you)
.
.
.
.
.
.
#mandontdance
#manmaycook 
#pleaselaugh
#donthurtmyfeelings 
#cookingathome
#dancingathome 
#whynotdobothatthesametime
#lifeunderlockdown
#quarantineandchill

#dancing #cookathome #mugcake #birthdaycake #icecreamlover #cookingvideos #Covid19 #gocorona #coronago #fuckcorona #itscoronatime #funnyshitpost #gottaentertainmyself

node.text: Happiest birthday wishes to @drsumiriyas ! ❤️ And a mountain of gratitude and love to a symbol of strength and courage, our grandmum.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Shaaz Ahmed on June 26, 2021. May be an image of indoor.

node.text:
Macha, what was in the Matcha? 🍵 
[Swipe To Read ⏩] 

A classic case of internal spiraling which ultimately ends in "Damn, what was that." 
How often do you take this unnecessary route ?

Feel free to write your version of a spiral in the comments below, I'll share my favourites. 
.
.
#ofwheelsandwords

Photo by Shaaz Ahmed on June 21, 2021. May be a closeup of 1 person and beard.

node.text:
The Morality Clause// 
[Swipe/Scroll to Read] 
🔸
I write my confessions in 
Unaddressed letters in the hopes 
That I'll have the courage to write 
Down the names of those I hurt
Before it's too late. 
I'm a sinner digging 
A shallow grave to bury deep sins, 
Because my therapist says I have to make amends to achieve some form of closure. 

I think of when I was being lulled
In my lover's arms, 
I tell her, "teach me how to play fair";
And she says, "Darling, what's fair in a world 
Where morals change over time and distance."
We kiss and I smile as I fall asleep, 
Only to wake up to an empty bed and 
A note which said, 
"Time has run along, as must I." 
I never saw her again. 

I remember feeling hurt in a way that 
Never really went away and I tell my 
Therapist how I hate this god damn 
Language; how much of a distance
Can there be between love and lover 
And he says, "as much as there
Can be between love and loved."
And I think of the people I ran away from. 

And maybe it's not the language
I hate but the way people use it, 
So I've got words I should have said
And feelings that shouldn't have died
Laid on white papers enveloped in a coffin 
I painted mulberry wine in a drunken stupor; 
I finally pack up the courage to write down 
The names I wish I didn't have to, leave them
In the mailbox and hit the bed where I pray
For better days to come. 

It's been a few days and my therapist asks
Me how it felt, I say I didn't get much in return
But it still feels like a weight lifted off my chest. I ask if this is closure, 
And he says, "only you can decide that, 
But what this is, is an opening for you to 
Move forward from a place you've been 
Stuck in." 

// A lover taught me that morals change over time and distance, 
My therapist taught me that while we have no say over time, I get to control the distance.
.
.
Prompts - 
▫️Shallow graves.
▫️Teach me how to play fair.
▫️Paint my coffin mulberry wine. 
By @the__gypsysoul__ 🌸
.
.
#ofwheelsandwords 
📸 : Self Portrait.

node.text:
If The Men in My House Were Flowers Not Swords//
[Swipe or scroll to Read] 
🌸

There's a disconnect in the way 
I've connected with the men in this 
Household, in that we have never 
Fully understood each other. 

I pray for us to see eye to eye, 
Yet there's a misaligned window and 
A crack in the wall and the light is 
All wrong, and I'm always just a preposition 
Away from making them proud.
And I weep, I say I'm sorry I don't believe 
In an eye for an eye. 

Men in this household find the cracks 
In our walls by saying things this grey 
Are not pretty and fix them by white 
Washing over them till they're left buried. 
They adorn them with old swords from 
A bygone era to speak of how sharp
They used to be and the strength it takes 
To wield one, much less parry another. 

I hold my tongue from reminding them 
That the swords may have rusted 
And lost their sheen,
But their words are as sharp as ever, 
With a bitter edge that cuts like no other; 
I wonder how much strength lies in the
Callousness of their comments collecting 
Collateral damage in this war they still wage
In the name of strength, 
For their kids haven't faced 
Enough hardships to make them 
tough like the men they ought to be. 

There's a seed I sow everytime 
I'm told that grown men don't cry and 
8 springs have passed where I've watched flowers bloom and wither and fade, 
out of the tears I wash away. 
I'm asked what sense there is to
nurture things so weak and 
I pretend I wasn't meant to be
Collateral damage, Instead I tell them 
I wish the men in 
My house were flowers not swords. 

They laugh at me till they notice 
All the cracks in my room 
bearing plants I have watered and they 
Ask me why. 
I say, there's only so much 
burying you can do before 
they resurface, 
I'd rather watch them bear fruit. 

They scoff as they leave the room 
And it won't be until I'm another five
mistakes older when another war breaks out. 
This time our world will rattle, our floors 
Will rumble and our house will fall 
But my walls will stand and while their
Swords have them impaled they'll
Ask me how I'm left standing. 
.
[Continued in Comments] 
.
.
#ofwheelsandwords

This time our world will rattle, our floors Will rumble and our house will fall But my walls will stand and while their Swords have them impaled they'l Ask me how I'm left standing. And I'll tell them, if only the men in My house were flowers not swords, They would' 've had flower beds to fall onto Instead of their own blades. -s.a'.
Photo by Shaaz Ahmed on June 13, 2021.

node.text:
Yin Yang // ☯️
[Swipe To Read] 

For those of you who have been having a hard time accepting yourself, I hope this provides some solace. 
I understand there are days where we aren't what we hoped or wished we would turn out to be, 
There are days we find it difficult to accept ourselves for who and what we are, be it physically or mentally.

And if you're one of those people today, I hope you know that for every flaw you've been picking out to criticise yourself for, there's a page full of good in you that you've been skimming over. 
If you're feeling a little more lonely today than usual, here's my version of a hug in the form of poetry. 

No matter how much or how little light you have today, I hope your nurture it and use it well, for a future that is truly and completely, you. 
And you are beautiful. 
. 
.
#ofwheelsandwords. 
📸 : #selfportrait #shotonphone

May be an image of text that says 'Yin Yang: Darkness draws me in like a Con man out for money, And am but a fool who' been told One too many times that my face is Not one that would draw a second glance, Much less be on the cover of magazines. He places bet he cannot lose, And accept because I'm convinced that /look better in the dark because there's Less of me to see. /have face that looks better in the shadows, And we're gambling in a dimly lit room, So I'm confident of my chances.'.

node.text:
We wear the same skin as you. 

[Swipe To Read] : 
Bruised Dreams// 

@cyanaidu asked me to write something using dreams. 
And this has been something that's been weighing heavily on my mind, and every other doctor in the country. 
Dreams slowly turning into nightmares is no joke. 
Our lives running on thin lines to make sure yours is better is no joke. 
We never asked to be put on impractical pedestals that are out of our own reach. 
We aren't bigger than life. 
We wear the same skin as you. 
We're human, just like you. 
If nothing else, treat us with the same compassion you would show others. 
If you aren't speaking out already, you should. 
If you can't form your own words, share the words of others. 
Stand with your doctors so we can stand for you. 
.
.
.
#ofwheelsandwords

"Murderer" hisses the waiter as he bares his teeth at me. I'm shivering, "A dream. This must be a dream. didn't kill him, tried my best. swear.' "Better wake up then, doctor. If you can that is. he says, before he swings the bottle at my head.'.

node.text:
Love In Worn Out Sweaters//
🔹
A friend once told me that the things I say sometimes, or at least the way I say them are too complex, 
That most people would understand better if I wrote a little simpler often. 
I understand it and fear it. 
I understand that a lot of my words won't resonate with the people that read them, 
And I fear that if I let that stop me, 
A lot of people wouldn't see a part of me I wish would be understood. 

And I was told that it's okay, to be true to myself,
That a lot of people don't need to understand you,
You just need to keep the ones that do. 
I understand it. 
And fear it. 
I understand that it's okay to not be seen and heard in a crowd,
I fear that the ones who do won't stay as long as I'd like them to. 

So I was told that everything I'm feeling, all these questions, all these doubts - they're valid and that's part of life,
And in the end, 
Maybe what life essentially boils down to is an act of letting go. 
I understand it. 
And fear it. 
I understand that things don't last as often as I'd wish they would and that's okay. 
I fear that one day I'd have lost enough to forget what it's like to hold on to the things I want. 

I was asked to write this down in more comprehensible terms, 
So I took a picture of me and said, 
I'm a simple man who finds hope and love in a sweater he's worn for far too long, 
And I'm afraid there are one too many holes that can no longer be filled to keep me warm, 
And I'm much too tired to get a new one. 

And maybe not a lot of people would understand that, 
But the ones that do, tell me I look great in this sweater, 
And the holes don't feel as large anymore, 
And I hold on, just a little longer. 
.
.
.
#ofwheelsandwords

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Shaaz Ahmed on May 28, 2021. May be an image of 1 person, beard, standing and indoor.

node.text:
Sunrise Oranges in Brown Coffins.
🔹
[TW : Depression]

There is a feeling I cannot quite explain that sits at the back of my throat like a malignant idea yet to grow large enough for me to spit out before it seeps into my veins. 

There are days like this, like I'm at the cusp of something I cannot see, 
Standing at the edge of a cliff I'm too afraid to look over. 
I've got one half of a brain that tells me I won't survive and the other half which whispers to me that I won't know till I take the dive, 
And one whole brain that tells me it doesn't matter in the end because frankly, who gives a fuck. 

There are days like this, where I'm not sure of the things I say and the person I am, 
Where I have no pride left to swallow but there's enough and more self doubt to drink the nights away. 
I'm an alcoholic always ordering two mugs of draught fear to start with only to finish a week and three caskets before I check online to pick a design for my fourth and final where I can lay to rest.
Retail therapy helps when you've ordered the right fit and I can't think of a better one for me than a wooden box that matches my skin to hold me better than my arms ever did.
There are nights so dark I might as well have my eyes closed, 
There are nights like this where I wish I didn't wake up. 

I fall asleep before I hit order, to wake up to a new day with a sky set ablaze it's almost hard to remember what the dark looked like. 

I remember there are days like this where the sun shines so bright it tickles my skin to make me smile even if just a little. 
Days where I'm standing at the edge of a cliff and I don't need to look how far down I could fall because there's a gorgeous sky dancing in tangerine shades, it's almost a dream. 

I have one half of a brain that tells me I might just survive and the other half whispering to me that I won't know till I take the dive,
And one whole brain that tells me it doesn't matter if I don't know because the sky is so pretty and I should just live to see it again,
Because quite frankly, 
Who gives a fuck? 
.
.
📸 : Self Portrait shot on phone. 
.
.
#ofwheelsandwords

node.text:
No poetry today. Just some heart to heart.

For those of you who've known me through the college days, my health was never on its best legs, 
2019 especially took a toll on me, being one of my worst years.
And I decided after what would seem like eons, that I would change that about me. 
As a human being, I should have paid more attention to my health, 
As a doctor, even more so, lead by example isn't it?
It's been a year and a lot of hard work, but I think I can safely say I've taken a step forward in the right direction, 
Both for my mental and physical health. 
It hasn't been a straight shot, it's come with its own curves and difficulties, but if I'm anything to go by,
And you're having a rough day, a week, a month or maybe a year,
Here's a reminder that you can and will achieve what you've set out to do, 
You are strong,
Believe in yourself. 
I believe in you. 

A lot of you also know that over the last year I have been delving a little more into portrait photography. 
So you're probably going to see a little more of that for a while. 
Call it vanity, call it self appreciation,
I'm just taking a moment to reaffirm how far I've come. 

Strong today, stronger tomorrow 💪🏼
.
.
.
#ofwheelsandwords

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Shaaz Ahmed in Healing. May be an image of nature, body of water, twilight and tree.

node.text:
Revolution //

1. A stranger asks me what it was like, 
My first heartbreak. 

2. I remember telling you that even the worst parts of you looked beautiful, 
Till I realised that the worst of it all was me. 

3. I did not loathe myself, but there was a hurt buried so deep inside, digging it out felt like digging my own grave. 

4. They say time heals everything, but it barely existed around you, not in a way that mattered anyway. 

5. There was a nail stuck to my chest with a pendulum hanging on by a thread,
And I counted the seconds with every blow you struck. 

6. The pendulum swinged but not in any particular direction or pattern and I think that was the best way to describe time as you touched it, erratic, irrational. 

7. I'd lost count of the number of times I said you broke my heart. 
They made as much sense as the seconds I'd counted. 

8. Some days I wished it was as easy as just a broken heart. You didn't just break me, you didn't just take away from me, no, 
You also filled me;
With the worst parts of me. 

9. Some days I wished you had said I was beautiful anyway. 

10. You took. 
And you took. 
And you took. 
No one told me emptiness weighs heavier when you're trying to swim for your life. 

11. You gave. 
And you gave. 
And you gave. 
No one told me memories hold you by the throat and watch you drown. 

12. They say time heals everything, 
They don't tell you it's your worst enemy when you're suffocating. 

13. My lungs were on fire. The sky was on fire.
My arms were failing, the walls were crumbling. 
There were people screaming. 

14. No. I was screaming. 

15. They say that it is darkest before dawn. 
So I pulled myself to shore and looked at the rising sun, praying that the worst of it was over. 

16. There was a nail with a pendulum attached that laid in the dirt where I sat.
I was bleeding, but I was breathing. 
I was hurting, but I was healing. 

17. It's been seven summers since time started again. 
I am no longer the man I once was. 
I am no longer screaming. 

18. A stranger asked me what it was like, my first heartbreak. 
I tell him you weren't a heartbreak, 
You were a revolution. 
.
.
.
#ofwheelsandwords

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Shaaz Ahmed in Dream with @silverleafpoetry, @scribblersword, @globalagepoetry, @globalagecaption, @profound.artists, @brownhourpoetry, @_inkverse, @thewriteristichutofficial, and @wovenverses. May be an image of nature, body of water and twilight.

node.text:
I've found a taste for the limitless skies, 
And the sun that sets it on fire,
The clouds that carry a 
weight much like my own, 
To weep as we will, on days we 
can no longer go on. 
For the leaves that dance to the weary winds whispering lost secrets of a time long forgotten, 
Leaving echoes of a life that runs through hills, forests and untouched trails. 

I see stranger people who lead simpler lives, 
As I wade through oceans of divide,
On tides I'm still learning. 
City boy they call me,
Thriving in a maze of concrete towers and square rooms amidst sounds of a world that knew no sleep. 
"What brings you here to a world that is not your own?", they ask. 
And I wonder, I have no answer, 
I say, I'm afraid I've sipped from a glass of the world as it had been created and not as we'd changed it, and I want more. 
I am a lost boy, searching for the last patch of grass where I can put down my burdens, 
To close my eyes and fall asleep to the sound of a silence that has long eluded me. 

They laugh and point to the 
Chains that bind my feet,
"This is as far as you'll go today son, 
No further, 
Not like that." 

I sport a worn out smile as I fall asleep to my own thoughts, 
I am a hypocrite,
To wander a thousand miles for a good night's sleep, only to wake next morning
And return to the cage I am afraid to break. 
I'm a creature of habit, 
Chasing fleeting moments of comfort, 
To tell myself that dreams are dreams, 
They were only meant to last 
so long as I was asleep. 

// I am still learning to dream with my eyes open. 

🔸

Had a dream, was in a distant unknown land. People said I didn't belong, I knew I didn't belong, I tried anyway. 
Any of you got weird dreams lately ? 

🔸

Also, Eid Mubarak everyone 🌜
.
.
#ofwheelsandwords

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Shaaz Ahmed in Happy Place. May be an image of cloud, nature and twilight.

node.text:
A friend asked me a while ago,
What made me happy, 
And I said I wouldn't know. 
I said happiness could smack me in the face 
And I wouldn't be able to tell it apart, 
I said I felt like I had rainbows around me 
And all I cared about was how grey the clouds were. 

He laughed and said I sound broken, 
I figured, maybe I was,
But I was too tired to try and fix it.
What's another broken heart when we walk 
On the ones that turned to dust. 

I'm aware, my poems talk like a dying man, 
I just wish it was a man who 
Lived his life with no regrets. 
But I say art is a growing tragedy,
Weave my sorrow into words
And call myself a poet. 

There's a girl I met who makes me
Want to hold her hand, 
But I've been more terrified than ever. 
I ask her, where do you think 
broken hearts go? 
And she smiles before she says, 
Nowhere, they fall where we
stood till we decide to pick it up again. 
So I went back to pick up the pieces I'd left behind, for a smile I wish to carry forward. 

It took me a while to understand, 
And it didn't hit me till I was standing
In the fruits section of a 
run down grocery store.
I had her hand in my left 
And my heart in my right, 
And I remember wondering,
Were the oranges really this vibrant?
Had I ever picked apples so red? 

I call my friend to tell him that
Maybe happiness had struck me in the face,
And this time, I recognize it. 
My words are finally breathing again, 
And I don't feel so broken. 
He asked me what changed, 
And I told him there was a hand 
I wanted to hold and I couldn't,
Not when I was falling apart. 

"So, what is it? " 
"What's what?"
"What makes you happy?" 
I chuckled before I replied, 
"Bright Oranges and Red Apples." 

//I'm learning to appreciate colours a little more, 
My poems are no longer dying, 
And Art is no more a tragedy than what you make it to be. 
.
.
.
Back after a long hiatus. 
So, what makes you happy? 
.
.
#ofwheelsandwords

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Shaaz Ahmed on March 06, 2021. May be an image of lake and nature.

node.text:
[Swipe to Read] ⏩
🔹
Came across this story recently and just had to write. 
Leaving the relevant history below.
🔹
The first part of Anne's story is cast in shadow and not much is known about her. 
We know her now as Anne, but in the 1880s, when her body was recovered from the River Seine, the French knew her as “L’Inconnue de la Seine” (“The Unknown Woman of the Seine”).
Her body showed no signs of physical injury and the death was considered a suicide. 

As was practice then, the body was put on public display to be identified at the Paris morgue. However, despite the crowd, her identity was never verified. 
A mortician working at the morgue, captivated by her serene beauty, ordered a plaster cast of her face. A copy of this mask was hung outside a Paris shop sparking a public fascination with the girl’s enchanting final expression. 

Countless copies of this mask would then be created, and become highly coveted as a work of art, gracing the walls of homes and businesses in Europe. 
And the mysterious circumstances revolving around her death would become a muse for writers and poets - countless tales of a heartbroken girl, bereft of love and fortune, casting her life away in a romantic death by drowning. 

Over half a century later, in 1960, a group of doctors perfected a new life-saving technique called cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR). To properly train individuals in this revolutionary new technique the doctors determined a special training doll was needed.
They partnered with the Norwegian toy and medical device manufacturer, Asmund Laerdal. Having witnessed first hand the benefits of CPR, a few years earlier when his 2 year old son nearly drowned,
He was a strong believer in the cause. 

The doctors wanted the mannequin to be female. They feared their life-saving technique would be withheld from women by men uncomfortable with performing CPR on the opposite sex. By having men practice on a female doll it was hoped they would overcome their inhibition and render the life-saving aid.
Laerdal would then use the face of L'inconnue, inspired by a copy that hung in his parents' home. 
.
.
[Continued in comments] 
.
.
#ofwheelsandwords

May be an image of text that says 'Annie, are we okay?: You and we're two strangers in love, Fighting for our stars to cross paths, But we 're born out of different galaxies. They tell me I'm setting myself up for a heartbreak, They ask me why I'd do this. What insanity in heaven's name would ever make me willingly accept this predicament, And all ever did, All /could ever do, Was whisper your name.'.

Photo shared by Shaaz Ahmed on March 06, 2021 tagging @thewritingspook, @profound.artists, @_inkverse, @thewriteristichutofficial, and @wovenverses. May be an image of text that says 'Love always came easy to me, It takes root in me and flourishes ceaselessly till it bears fruit. But one bite of it and you'll learn that For every sweet scented flower which Grows unchecked in the hollow of my neck, I bear salt laden pomes that lace your lips With my tears so heavy, you wouldn't dare pick another.'.

Photo by Shaaz Ahmed on March 06, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'You see carry pain like /would my own child, Tend to it, nurture it, Embrace it and watch it bloom. They say I'm beautiful but terribly sad, And tell them there's nothing beautiful about heartbreak, Nor any poetry romantic enough to make so. so. Pain is ugly, heartbreak is ugly, But the healing that follows, That's where the beauty lies.'.

Photo by Shaaz Ahmed on March 06, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'There's an old story tell myself, Of how in the late 19th century,a nameless girl had drowned in the River Seine at the age of sixteen. L'inconnue de la Seine they had called her The Unknown woman of the Seine. Even in death she looked so beautiful That they made a cast of her face, A face that would then take the world by storm and half century later, form the model mannequin to learn and teach resuscitation, To save countless lives.'.
